messages.messageBody:
I'll see if my dad could take me up to Barnes and
Noble bookstore to those books and maybe just maybe
find the other "Musashi" books, I already have the
first book, thank you for the help, I appreciate that.

> such books. A
> little study of Shinto will reveal some interesting
> Japanese tales as well.
> _Joe

> ps - be sure to check out the "kappa"

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Samurai Legends
messages.msgSnippet: Andrea, You should check out the book Legends of the Samurai by Hiroaki Sato. It s a great read, but most of the happenings in it are more realistic than
messages.messageBody:
Andrea,
You should check out the book "Legends of the Samurai" by Hiroaki Sato.
It's a great read, but most of the happenings in it are more realistic
than fantasy. Definately a good start. Also, head out to Barnes and
Noble (or Amazon) and check the mythology section for books like
"Japanese Fairy Tales" by Keiske Nishimoto and other such books. A
little study of Shinto will reveal some interesting Japanese tales as well.
_Joe

ps - be sure to check out the "kappa" turtle-demon!!!!

Andrea Smith wrote:

>Hey, I put my mind into what I'm writing and now I
>need some help with Japanese legends, I live in the
>real world but my mind wanders into the fantasy. I'm
>writing a samurai legend and I'm still looking on the
>Internet and I can't find what I'm looking for, were
>there samurai that had legends written about them?"
>
>
>
